title: Food Today
summary: Find food pantries, hot meals, and SNAP help.
note: Start with 211 for local food options. Availability can change daily.

title: Shelter & Safe Sleep
summary: Shelters, warming centers, and safe-sleep options.
note: Call ahead when possible. Ask about ID requirements and intake times.

title: ID & Documents
summary: Replace ID, birth certificate, social security card, and records.
note: Start with 211 and local legal aid. Requirements vary by county.

title: Jobs & Income
summary: Job centers, resumes, benefits, and income help.
note: Use local workforce centers and libraries for computers and printing.

title: Youth & Runaway Resources
summary: Crisis help and programs for runaway and homeless youth.
note: If you are under 18 or on your own, start with the National Runaway Safeline.

title: LGBTQ+ Resources
summary: Crisis support and housing resources for LGBTQ+ youth.
note: If you are in crisis, contact Trevor Project or 988. Safer support options are listed here.

title: Hygiene, Clothing & Free Clinics
summary: Free/low-cost clinics, hygiene support, and clothing help.
note: Many food banks also have hygiene kits. Use 211 to locate local providers.

title: Domestic Violence Help
summary: Confidential help, safety planning, and shelters.
note: If itâ€™s unsafe to browse, stop and call 911 or the DV hotline from a safe phone.

title: Trusted Resource Directories
summary: Start here to find local help fast.
note: These are external services. Always confirm details with the provider.
